title: Mindfulness meditaci√≥n guiada por Mario Alonso Puig

Este tipo de atenci√≥n nos permite aprender a relacionarnos de forma directa con aquello que est√° ocurriendo en nuestra vida, aqu√≠ y ahora, en el momento presente. La atenci√≥n plena nos ayuda a recuperar nuestro equilibrio interno, atendiendo de forma integral a los aspectos de la persona; cuerpo, mente y esp√≠ritu. Practicando la atenci√≥n plena desarrollamos una mayor capacidad de discernimiento y de compasi√≥n. La pr√°ctica de esta atenci√≥n abre la puerta hacia nuevas posibilidades, nos trae al aqu√≠ y al ahora, nos invita a vivir una vida de manera plena y en el presente. title: Aceita√ß√£o √© mais uma das atitudes que cultivamos com a pr√°tica de mindfulness
description: A aceita√ß√£o √© uma atitude a ser cultivada ao praticar mindfulness. Consiste em ver as coisas como elas realmente se apresentam neste momento. Nem sempre as coisas se apresentam como gostar√≠amos, por√©m evit√°-las n√£o resolve a quest√£o.  Muita gente confunde aceita√ß√£o com passividade, mas √© o contr√°rio disso. Aceita√ß√£o tem a ver com a compreens√£o de que as coisas s√£o do jeito que s√£o, em n√≥s, nos outros, no mundo, e que h√° situa√ß√µes que est√£o fora do nosso controle. A partir da√≠, podemos tomar decis√µes conscientes a respeito da situa√ß√£o que nos apresenta no momento presente. Como descrevemos em mindfulness, a aceita√ß√£o significa ver as coisas como realmente s√£o, e n√£o como gostar√≠amos que fossem. Ao aceitarmos o momento presente tal qual ele se apresenta √© que poderemos tomar atitudes, com clareza, para lidar com ele, como se faz necess√°rio. A clareza, entretanto, vem de uma sabedoria interior que cultivamos ao enfrentar a realidade sem fugirmos, sem colocarmos "a sujeira debaixo do tapete". Em certas ocasi√µes, aceitar o momento tal qual se apresenta significa termos que assumir o fato que erramos. A√≠ √© important√≠ssimo encarar o erro, e aceit√°-lo como uma experi√™ncia de aprendizagem e n√£o como um motivo de abrigarmos sentimentos negativos direcionados a n√≥s mesmos. A autocompaix√£o √© essencial neste caso. Assim, a aceita√ß√£o √© o processo de nos abrirmos e n√£o lutarmos contra a nossa experi√™ncia a cada momento. Atrav√©s desta pr√°tica, come√ßamos a habitar o mundo da observ√¢ncia, do que se passa em nossas mentes, do que molda nossa realidade. Constatamos que o que vivenciamos muda de momento a momento, e que essas mudan√ßas n√£o definem quem realmente somos. (Gilbert e Choden, Mindful Compassion , 2014)

title: 10 Minute Guided Meditation for Mindfulness
description: This 10 minute guided meditation is designed to allow you to become more mindful and present. Use this morning meditation to help lower stress, reduce anxiety and increase your mindfulness.¬†Committing to a short 10 minute guided meditation practice every day is a proven way to help us all shrink feelings of stress in every day life. Feel free to use this video regularly as meditation for stress or pressure reduction at any point throughout the day.¬†This guided meditation can be used as morning meditation or as a body scan meditation. Either way mindfulness is something we can all practice and get better at day by day. Sometimes the best guided meditation we can follow are simple ones. Easy to follow 10 minute sessions that focus on mindful thoughts and deep breathing.The benefits of meditation and mindfulness don't end once you open your eyes. Take a moment afterwards to reflect on how you feel coming out of the meditation. Notice if your heart beat has slowed or if you feel you're no longer overthinking. These benefits may not last forever but that's why daily meditation or some kind of regular practice has powerful benefits long term.For beginners learning to meditate our body scan meditation and meditation for beginners videos linked above may be a great start to help this become a more regular practice. ¬† Support the show Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

title: Mindfulness Meditaci√≥n Guiada
description: Te doy la bienvenida! Soy Diana y estoy aqu√≠ para ayudarte a meditar.¬† ¬† ¬†¬†Si te gusta esta #meditaci√≥n, suscribirte a mi canal de Youtube. Nuevas meditaciones todas las semanas (es totalmente gratis!!): https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRvz-FxFCLJfn-LQvNC0vSw/videos ¬†¬† ¬† ¬†He preparado este tutorial de Mindfulness especialmente para mis queridos principiantes.¬† Tal vez estas listo para iniciarte en la practica de la meditaci√≥n y necesitas un punto de partida, o tal vez nunca antes has meditado y no est√°s seguro si vas a poder o si te va a gustar, o tal vez solo tienes curiosidad de saber como funciona y que se siente al meditar. La verdad, no importa que te trajo aqu√≠, lo que importa es que has llegado al lugar correcto. ¬†¬† ¬† ¬†Primero que nada, quiero que sepas que existen muchas formas diversas de meditar. Mindfulness, no es esa estereot√≠pica meditaci√≥n de sentarse como monje tibetano sin moverte, poniendo la mente en blanco, algo que requiere much√≠sima practica y much√≠sima disciplina. Honestamente, la gran mayor√≠a de nosotros, que no somos monjes tibetanos, no disponemos ni del tiempo, ni de la entrega necesaria para dedicar nuestras vidas a meditar largas horas todos los d√≠as. ¬†¬† ¬† ¬†Afortunadamente, existen formas mucho mas f√°ciles de conseguir los beneficios que ofrece la meditaci√≥n y Mindfulness es una de las formas de meditar m√°s f√°ciles que existen ya que no requiere de ning√∫n esfuerzo especial, solo tienes que respirar y estar presente. ¬†¬† ¬† ¬†A diferencia de otros tipos de meditaci√≥n y de otras meditaciones que he publicado, la practica mindfulness de hoy no tiene como meta ir por ning√∫n resultado espec√≠fico como el de reducir del estr√©s, o de sanar¬† tu ni√±o interior, o de despertar tu creatividad. Mas bien, el prop√≥sito de esta practica, o mejor dicho su efecto, es el de centrarte en el momento, de vivir en el presente, el aqu√≠ y el ahora. Lo que a su vez, logra, que naturalmente y sin ning√∫n esfuerzo de tu parte, vayas soltando cualquier carga que traigas contigo. Esta practica de mindfulness sirve para simplemente estar presentes en un estado consciente de fluidez d√°ndonos una muy merecida pausa, lejos de cualquier expectativa. Y es que al estar conscientes del momento presente, al estar presentes, estamos simult√°neamente recalibrando nuestra energia, y retomando mas claridad mental y emocional en nuestras vidas. Todo esto, sin ning√∫n esfuerzo especial. ¬†¬† ¬† ¬†La practica consiste en estar presente dandote cuenta de cu√°ndo la mente se distrae con pensamientos y regresar al ejercicio. Aunque la mente se vaya una o mil veces, simplemente date cuenta y regresa al ejercicio. En esto consiste la pr√°ctica, en estar presentes enfocando en el presente con algo muy sencillo como es nuestro interior, nuestra respiraci√≥n o nuestro cuerpo. Adem√°s, con esto conseguimos estar en √≠ntimo contacto con nuestro yo interior, reconociendo c√≥mo es nuestro ser, descubriendo c√≥mo nos sentimos mental y f√≠sicamente.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†Mientras mas practicas tu meditaci√≥n,¬† cada vez te&Support the show (https://www.patreon.com/user?u=34961381)  ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/message Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/support

title: 10 Minute Meditation for Mindfulness and Becoming More Present
description: Meditation has become increasingly popular in recent years, and for good reason. This practice has been shown to have numerous benefits for both the mind and body, including improving focus, reducing stress and anxiety, and increasing feelings of well-being. One of the most significant benefits of meditation is its ability to help individuals become more mindful and present in the moment.Mindfulness is a state of being fully present and engaged in the current moment, without judgment or distraction. It is a mental state that can be developed through regular meditation practice. When we are mindful, we are more aware of our thoughts and feelings and better able to manage them. This allows us to respond to situations with clarity and compassion rather than reacting impulsively.One of the ways that meditation helps cultivate mindfulness is by training the mind to focus on the present moment. During meditation, we typically focus on the breath or a mantra, which helps to anchor our attention in the present moment. As we continue to practice, we learn to let go of distractions and thoughts that pull us away from the present moment.Over time, this practice can extend beyond meditation sessions and into daily life. We become more aware of our surroundings, the sensations in our body, and our thoughts and emotions. We are better able to stay focused on the task at hand, rather than being pulled in multiple directions by distractions. This increased awareness can also help us identify and manage stress and anxiety more effectively.¬†Another benefit of meditation for mindfulness is its ability to increase self-awareness. Through meditation, we become more familiar with our thought patterns, emotions, and behaviors. This self-awareness allows us to recognize when we are getting caught up in negative or unhelpful thought patterns and make a conscious decision to shift our focus. We are better able to identify and manage emotions, rather than being controlled by them.Meditation can also help us become more compassionate and understanding towards ourselves and others. As we develop mindfulness, we learn to observe our thoughts and emotions without judgment. This allows us to be more accepting of ourselves and others, even when things don't go as planned. We are better able to respond to challenging situations with empathy and understanding, rather than reacting with frustration or anger.Finally, meditation can help us cultivate a sense of gratitude and appreciation for the present moment. By focusing on the present moment and becoming more aware of our surroundings and emotions, we are better able to appreciate the small things in life. This can help us develop a more positive outlook on life and increase feelings of well-being.In conclusion, meditation is a powerful tool for cultivating mindfulness and becoming more present in the moment. By training the mind to focus on the present moment, increasing self-awareness, and developing compassion and gratitude, we can improve our mental and emotional well-being and enjoy a more fulfilling life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, incorporating regular mindfulness meditation practice into your daily routine can have a profound impact on your life. title: Aging and longevity reimagined: Is mindfulness the secret?
description: Can the power of your thoughts help defy aging? Could your mind help improve your eyesight or even heal wounds faster?¬†These ideas might seem far-fetched, but our guest, Harvard Professor Ellen Langer, has spent four decades uncovering the real science behind this.In this episode, discover how to harness your mind-body connection to enhance your well-being.Ellen Langer is an American professor of psychology at Harvard University. In 1981, she became the first woman ever to be tenured in psychology at Harvard.¬†Prof. Langer studies the illusion of control, decision-making, aging, and mindfulness theory.Download our FREE guide ‚Äî Top 10 Tips to Live Healthier: https://zoe.com/freeguide If you want to uncover the right foods for your body, head to joinzoe.com/podcast and get 10% off your personalized nutrition program.Follow ZOE on Instagram.Timecodes:00:00   Introduction01:48¬† ¬† Quickfire questions04:34¬† ¬† The mind and body should be understood as one unit05:42  The counterclockwise study06:51  Chambermaid exercise study09:33¬† ¬† What is Mindfulness?10:59 All of the misery we experience is a function of our mindlessness14:47¬† ¬† Mindful optimism23:12¬† ¬† Everything should be different, every day of your life25:33¬† ¬† How Ellen approaches a simple eyesight test¬†¬†¬†¬†28:21  We have more control over our health and lives than we think‚Ä¶33:35¬† ¬† Placebos could be our strongest medicines‚Ä¶39:00¬† ¬† Blood sugar study results44:50¬† ¬† How to approach mindfulness54:05¬† ¬† SummaryMentioned in today‚Äôs episode:¬†Ageing as a mindset: A counterclockwise experiment to rejuvenate older adults sponsored by Catholic University of the Sacred HeartMind-set matters: Exercise and the placebo effect from Psychological ScienceThe Mindful Body and Mindfulness, two books by Prof. LangerEpisode transcripts are available here.Is there a nutrition topic you‚Äôd like us to explore? Email us at podcast@joinzoe.com, and we‚Äôll do our best to cover it.

title: Psicolog√≠a y Mindfulness para Todos
description: La meditaci√≥n, el mindfulness, la relajaci√≥n, la en pr√°cticas como el Yoga, el Pilates o el Tai-Chi, donde la respiraci√≥n es uno de los principios fundamentales de su t√©cnica, permite equilibrarla y reajustar el resto de mecanismos de nuestro cuerpo. Existen muchas t√©cnicas, diferentes ritmos y pautas respiratorias, pero el punto fundamental de todas es: LA CONSCIENCIA. Ser consciente del aire que entra y que sale, ya es el primer paso para poner en conexi√≥n mente-cuerpo. Entre algunos de los beneficios que podemos destacar al aprender y trabajar en la respiraci√≥n, ser√≠an: -El conocimiento del propio cuerpo a la perfecci√≥n (propiocepci√≥n). -La estabilizaci√≥n de la columna y movilizaci√≥n de las extremidades. -El control de los movimientos. -Los m√∫sculos se oxigenan, consiguiendo el m√°ximo estado de relajaci√≥n. ‚ÄìLocalizaci√≥n de cualquier tipo de tensi√≥n, ayudando a desbloquearla. -Eliminaci√≥n de toxinas, mejorando la luminosidad de la piel. ‚ÄìLa mente se aclara, se calma, se ilumina, se silencia, creando un estado de bienestar con el mundo y con uno mismo. ¬øNo crees que merezca la pena probarlo? Y sentirte en un estado m√°s sereno, arm√≥nico. Parece que la respiraci√≥n encierra valores de mucha importancia. En yoga, por ejemplo, la respiraci√≥n es Pranayama (Prana: energ√≠a vital / ayama: control y expansi√≥n) aunque profundizar√© en el tema m√°s adelante. Por el momento, dejar√© esta reflexi√≥n final: Respirar, es lo primero que hacemos al nacer, y nos acompa√±a en nuestras m√°ximas experiencias de vida y en este momento exacto t√© conecta con la vida ‚Äúinhala y respira profundo‚Äù eso es ‚Äúinhala y exhala lentamente y conscientemente‚Ä¶.‚Äù Si quieres ir experimentando las sensaciones en la atenci√≥n sobre la respiraci√≥n, propongo esta sencilla meditaci√≥n guiada   Psicologa Beatr√≠z Pereira Cartes

title: Episodio n.18 - Mindfulness Psicosomatica - Energetica dolce n.1.
description: üî∏Sito Web: ‚Å† ‚Å†‚Å†https://www.mariamichelaaltiero.it‚Å†  Nei protocolli mindfulness-based sono presenti alcune pratiche che ci consentono di coltivare la consapevolezza mentre il corpo √® in movimento. title: Top 3 Mindfulness Exercises To Calm Your Mind, Body, And Soul
description: Use these top three mindfulness exercises in order to live the happiest and healthiest life possible. In life, there are many unexpected situations that cause stress and chaos. Free Weekly Newsletter To Learn Meditation So You Can Meditate More Effectively HERE... It is critical to learn how to deal with these situations and feelings, in light of this fact, it is necessary to be familiar with healthy mindfulness exercises for calming the body as well as the mind and the soul. Learn More About Mindfulness Exercises To Calm Your Mind, Body And Soul Here... One of the most effective methods for accomplishing this is through mindfulness. Following is a list of the top 3 mindfulness practices for calming your entire being. Three Mindfulness Exercises to Calm the Body, the Mind, and the Spirit 1. Take several deep breaths. As we breathe, we keep ourselves alive, but deep and intentional breathing allows us to enjoy life more fully. Countless studies have demonstrated that mindfulness exercises using deep breathing techniques have a variety of beneficial effects, including lowering the risk of cardiovascular disease, reducing stress, and increasing positive emotions in participants.  As a result, deep breathing is considered to be one of the most effective methods of calming the body, mind, and soul.  Various deep breathing mindfulness exercises are available for you to try out. Counted breathing is a popular method of relaxation. When you count the seconds between each inhale, hold, and exhale, you are practicing counted breathing. This technique is popular because it provides you with something to concentrate on while you are taking a deep breath in and out.  Although the majority of people begin by attempting to inhale for 4 seconds, hold for 5 seconds, and exhale for 7 seconds, you can adjust the timing to suit your needs. Simply lengthen the exhale to be longer than the inhale.  2. Meditative practices Many people believe that meditation is difficult or takes a long period of time. As a result, they avoid meditation because they believe it is inappropriate for them. These preconceived notions about meditation are simply untrue. Anyone can meditate and reap the benefits of doing so. In fact, studies have shown that meditation lowers the risk of cardiovascular disease, helps to regulate emotions, and increases overall life satisfaction (or happiness). 28 Mindfulness Techniques And Ideas To Enhance Your Life If you are new to meditation, one of the most straightforward mindfulness exercises methods is to focus your attention on your breath. Deep breathing will be used in this technique, but it will be taken a step further. Close your eyes and begin breathing slowly and steadily. This is a very effective meditation technique by itself. Draw your attention to the air and your breath as your breathing begins to slow on its own. As you breathe in, pay attention to the temperature of the air and the sensation that it has as it enters, travels down your throat, and leaves your mouth. After you take a deep breath, try to visualize the air swirling throughout your body. You could also try focusing on an image or mantra instead of your breath to see if that helps. Meditation Success: 10 Easy Guidelines You Can Use Today You may find yourself having thoughts while you are meditating using these mindfulness exercises. Simply acknowledge the thoughts and gently release them once they have come to a natural conclusion, as described above. 3. Progressive Muscle Relaxation That Develops Over Time When practicing Progressive Muscle Relaxation as mindfulness exercises, you will tense and relax each and every muscle group in your body one at a time. This practice is beneficial because it forces you to pay attention to how your body feels in the present moment, as well as forcing you to relax your muscles. This practice is particularly beneficial before bedtime. Inhale deeply and tense a muscle group for 4 to 10 seconds, starting at the top of the head. Tensing one muscle group at a time for 10 to 20 seconds before relaxing the next. It's important to pay attention to how your body feels both tensed and relaxed. Do they have a different sensation? Once you've gone through each muscle group, count backward from 5 to 1 to bring your attention back to the present moment. Unbelievably Easy Ways To Improve Your Life... Suffer from Insomnia?? title: Moeiteloze Mindfulness Meditatie
description: In deze geleide meditatie wil ik je laten ervaren dat onszelf zijn (bewustzijn zijn) iets moeiteloos is. We hoeven niet ons best te doen om bewust te zijn want onze essentie is bewustzijn. Aanwezig zijn (mindfulness) wordt dan niet iets wat we doen maar wat we zijn. Stop met je best doen en laat je mee gaan met de stroom van het leven. Zie hoe moeiteloos het leven zich aan je toon. Zie dat waar je nu bent, precies is waar je moet zijn. Dat er niks ontbreekt. Daar neem ik jullie in deze meditatie in mee.

title: 35. Cultivando la conciencia con el mindfulness y el yoga. Mejora tu bienestar mental con Alejandra Rodr√≠guez.
description: Hoy vamos a hablar de bienestar mental, de mindfulness, de yoga, de sentirnos bien en nuestras mentes, de evolucionar y trabajar nuestra conciencia para mejorar nuestras vidas. Lo que vamos a hablar hoy no lo puedes encontrar en literatura cient√≠fica, pero es que el ser humano es mucho m√°s que aquello que puede abarcar o explicar la ciencia. El objetivo de este podcast es que vivas una vida plena y feliz, por lo tanto hablar de esta dimensi√≥n de la mente humana que yo misma trabajo y cultivo, es para m√≠ imprescindible, y me hace mucha ilusi√≥n poder compartirlo con vosotros.¬† Para esta conversaci√≥n he invitado a Alejandra Rodriguez, m√°s conocida en instagram como @spiritualwoman, ella se define como coach humanista, mentora, escritora y formadora. Es autora de los libros "El camino consciente" y "SLOW LIFE", que os recomiendo much√≠simo. title: 13¬∞ Puntata "Osservare i pensieri"
description: In questa puntata impareremo ad osservare i pensieri senza dover fare niente di particolare. Fermarsi e non fare niente sembra essere un controsenso per la nostra societ√†, pu√≤ sembrare persino irresponsabile o stupido, in un mondo in cui l‚Äôambizione ed il perfezionismo sono qualit√† fondamentali. Viviamo in una societ√† con una cultura improntata verso il progresso ed il futuro e abbiamo dimenticato che possiamo fermarci e ogni tanto sperimentare semplicemente il fatto di esistere. Cosa significa rilassare la mente? Magari pensiamo ad una mente libera da qualsiasi pensiero o emozione, ma non √® questo.Una mente rilassata √® una mente che non cerca di controllare niente, di mettere a posto o di migliorare, qualsiasi cosa stia succedendo nel momento presente. Il primo elemento della mente rilassata √® la sua qualit√† di lasciare andare l‚Äôimpulso a fare qualcosa, ad attivarsi.

title: 15¬∞ Puntata "Consapevolezza delle emozioni"
description: In questa puntata faremo esperienza di come i pensieri e le emozioni siano sempre presenti nella nostra esperienza, ma con la consapevolezza, possiamo imparare a relazionarci a loro in modo diverso.Pensieri, emozioni e la reattivit√† che ne consegue, agiscono appena al di sotto della consapevolezza. Le immagini, i pensieri e le emozioni, scorrono nella mente come una corrente sotterranea e se non prestiamo loro attenzione, ne veniamo influenzati in maniera inconsapevole. Quando veniamo catturati in una spirale di pensieri o impulsi emotivi negativi, non vediamo pi√π chiaramente e non riusciamo ad agire con saggezza. Immaginiamo invece, di aver allenato la mente e di trovarci in una situazione in cui magari abbiamo perso il controllo in passato. Cosa pu√≤ succedere di diverso? Ci siamo allenati a creare uno spazio, tra lo stimolo e la reazione, in questo modo, abbiamo il tempo di notare che i pensieri sono solo pensieri e rappresentano soltanto una piccola parte della realt√†. In questo modo, riusciamo a rispondere con pi√π saggezza. Il nostro stato mentale ha un enorme importanza nelle interazioni con le altre persone. Se quando siamo di cattivo umore riusciamo a connetterci con quello che sentiamo, possiamo evitare magari di avere scatti di nervosismo o frustrazione con le altre persone.

Estas ruedas o discos giratorios de energ√≠a deben permanecer ‚Äúabiertos‚Äù y alineados, ya que corresponden a grupos de nervios, √≥rganos y √°reas de nuestro cuerpo energ√©tico que afectan nuestro bienestar f√≠sico y emocional. ¬†Notaras que a medida que asciende el orden de los chakras van apareciendo caracter√≠sticas que directamente influencian nuestro bienestar general y nuestro √©xito en la vida tanto f√≠sica como espiritual. Notaras que estas caracter√≠sticas van ascendiendo igualmente en forma jer√°rquica, Empezando primeramente por todo lo que es f√≠sico, del cuerpo en si, seguido por lo mental, lo emocional y culminando en lo espiritual. ¬†Hay 7 chakras principales y estos controlan nuestras propiedades fisiol√≥gicas, psicol√≥gicas y emocionales. Los chakras ubicados en la parte inferior de nuestro cuerpo son nuestro lado instintivo, nuestro lado animal por decirlo as√≠, mientras que los ubicados en la parte superior representan nuestro lado mental y espiritual. En un mundo ideal, todos nuestros chakras deber√≠an contribuir al correcto funcionamiento de nuestro ser y de todos nuestros sistemas. Sin embargo, este no es siempre el caso. Sucede a veces que algunos chakras no est√°n lo suficientemente abiertos (o activos), y para contrarrestar esto, otros chakras se vuelven ¬†hiperactivos. El estado ideal es donde todos los chakras est√°n en equilibrio. ¬†El orden ascendiente de los chakras nos muestra que primero debemos tener nuestras necesidades f√≠sicas en orden si queremos existir en el mundo f√≠sico y A medida que avanza la jerarqu√≠a de los chakras, vamos ascendiendo desde las necesidades inferiores del f√≠sico hasta las necesidades superiores del esp√≠ritu. ¬†Si has tomado cursos de psicolog√≠a, tal vez este concepto te parezca similar al de Maslow y su pir√°mide de Jerarqu√≠a de las Necesidades Humanas. No se sabe si Maslow formulo su teor√≠a en 1943 inspirado por en el sistema de los Chakras que originaron en la India se piensa entre 500 a 1500 a√±os antes de Cristo, pero en mi opinion los Chakras estan representados en la pir√°mide de Maslow. title: 39¬∞ Puntata "Accogliere i pensieri"
description: √à un‚Äôesperienza comune a chiunque si avvicini alla meditazione o alla mindfulness di riconoscere quanto siano incessanti i nostri pensieri. Sono un flusso continuo di giudizi e commenti, pianificazioni e preoccupazioni senza sosta.I nostri pensieri fanno tutti parte del nostro film personale in corso in cui il protagonista siamo noi. Si stima che abbiamo circa 60.000 pensieri al giorno e il 95% sono gli stessi che avevamo ieri, quindi viviamo in questo piccolo bozzolo familiare, ossessionati da qualche sfida sul lavoro, rimpiangendo qualcosa che abbiamo fatto o non fatto, elaborando strategie su come affronteremo la giornata. I nostri pensieri creano la nostra esperienza di vita e se la nostra abitudine √® quella di generare molte preoccupazioni, vivremo con l'ansia.Il primo passo per portare la consapevolezza al pensiero √® riconoscere che i pensieri stanno accadendo. Ora, potrebbe sembrare semplice, ma in realt√† √® piuttosto impegnativo, ed √® la ragione per cui la maggior parte della giornata, andiamo in giro persi nei nostri pensieri come se fossimo al cinema, credendo che sia realt√†, Se per√≤ iniziamo ad essere testimoni dei nostri pensieri, scopriamo che i pensieri creano una storia nella nostra mente basata sulle rappresentazioni del nostro mondo. I pensieri sono una realt√† virtuale basata sulle nostre credenze e condizionamenti. Non sono spesso la realt√†

title: Guided Mindfulness Hypnotherapy to unwind
description: Please enjoy this guided hypnotherapy to calm your anxiety by accessing your subconscious mind. This is where deeply ingrained beliefs and patterns of thought and behaviour are stored. By inducing deep relaxation and heightened suggestibility, guided hypnotherapy can help you access your subconscious mind. It can also reprogram negative thought patterns and beliefs that contribute to anxiety. During this guided hypnotherapy session, calming language and imagery will guide you into a relaxed state. These visualization techniques will enable you to imagine a peaceful and calming scene, such as a beach or lake. This can help activate the parasympathetic nervous system, which counteracts the "fight or flight" response triggered by anxiety. Through repeated hypnotherapy sessions, you can learn to access this relaxed state on your own and develop new coping mechanisms for managing your anxiety. You can identify and address any underlying emotional or psychological factors that may contribute to your anxiety. Audice Nasser, Ph.D., is a Clinical Counselling Hypnotherapist (C.Hyp‚Ñ¢), a Certified Hypnotherapist (CHt) member, and a Regression Therapist registered with The International Medical and Dental Hypnotherapy Association (IMDHA), The International Association of Counselors and Therapists (IACT), The International Alliance of Professional Hypnotists (IAPH), and the National Guild of Hypnotists. She is a Neuro-linguistic Programming Practitioner and Time Line Therapy¬Æ Practitioner registered with the American Board for Hypnotherapy and NLP (ABH-NLP). Audice is a Certified Brainspotting Therapist (‚Ñ¢) registered with Brainspotting International and Brainspotting Canada Association. She is a Certified Hatha Yoga Teacher, registered with the Canadian Yoga Alliance. title: Meditaci√≥n mindfulness para reducir el estr√©s cuerpo-mente.

Estudios rigurosos con monjes tibetanos, que dedican la mayor parte de su vida a la meditaci√≥n consciente. Se ha demostrado que las regiones cerebrales asociadas a las emociones positivas, al sentido de pertenencia, a la autoeficacia se activan mucho m√°s en estos monjes que han pasado 20 o 30 a√±os meditando cuando se comparan con seres humanos promedio.   Por lo tanto, esto nos revela dos cosas. El bienestar no es s√≥lo un concepto abstracto, es mensurable, medible. Y en segundo lugar, cuando practicamos deliberadamente habilidades que promueven el bienestar, se producen cambios reales en el cerebro. Se crean nuevos caminos neuronales gracias a la neuroplasticidad maravillosa que tenemos como seres humanos.   ‚ÄúCuando le proporcionamos a la gente las habilidades para ser consciente de s√≠ misma y nos reporta c√≥mo le va, su respuesta es corroborada por nuevas regiones cerebrales que muestran que su bienestar realmente ha mejorado. title: 15 Minute Mindfulness Meditation ~ How to be Present
description: During this mindfulness meditation we'll be spending 15 minutes of guided meditation focusing on how to be present. Letting go of negative emotions and concentrating on how to be mindful.Mindfulness is becoming a more popular subject. With the rise in mental health awareness, becoming more mindful is a way of increasing our own self-awareness in every day life. You don't need to have anxiety, depression or other mental health concerns in order to practice mindfulness. Those that want to become more mindful in their lives do so for a variety of reasons, not least of which include increasing their positive energy and internal happiness. ¬†Following a guided meditation for mindfulness is one of the fastest and easiest ways to be more present and mindful day by day and moment to moment. What mindfulness meditation does is allows you a few uninterrupted minutes of peace inside your own head to check in with yourself. Some guided time walking through your body and mind to see how everything is. Being present enough to follow a mindful meditation practice will in time help you find a small corner of calm within your own mind whenever you may need it.¬†Mindfulness meditations have lots of benefits. They can reduce anxiety, limit your overthinking and relieve stress sometimes on a large scale. But these meditations have one main goal. That goal is for you to become more self-aware. To increase your ability to look at your mind, your body and your life from outside your own head. Becoming more self-aware means that you're able to look at all the good and bad in your life and accept it, without judgement, knowing that you're doing your best and becoming more mindful of everything is only going to help you do better.¬† Support the show Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

title: üéß PIERDE EL MIEDO A ENFERMAR Meditaci√≥n Guiada para Aliviar la Hipocondr√≠a y Ansiedad por Enfermedad
description: Dile adi√≥s a la hipocondr√≠a. Si prefieres solo Meditaci√≥n para aliviar la ansiedad, te invito a escuchar la version corta.¬† Esta meditaci√≥n incluye un ejercicio cognitivo-conductual que ayuda a reconocer las creencias y los sentimientos que alimentan el problema de hipocondr√≠a, impulsando a adoptar patrones de pensamiento y conducta m√°s sanos resultando muy eficaz para reducir los s√≠ntomas de ansiedad por la salud. El ejercicio cognitivo-conductual es una forma de entender c√≥mo piensas acerca de ti mismo, de otras personas y del mundo que te rodea, y c√≥mo lo que haces afecta a tus pensamientos y sentimientos. La idea es ayudar a cambiar la forma c√≥mo piensas ("cognitivo") y c√≥mo act√∫as ("conductual") y estos cambios te pueden ayudar a sentirte mejor. ¬†¬†Esta meditaci√≥n es una amiga sabia y compasiva para quienes sufren de hipocondr√≠a. Para quienes, sin tener pruebas medicas, se la pasan pensando siempre lo peor creyendo estar enfermos, o quienes sufren de miedo obsesivo a contraer alguna enfermedad grave llegando a veces a afectar su vida social, laboral y familiar, y es tambi√©n para aquellos que creen que su salud est√° constantemente amenazada por microbios peligrosos que se encuentran por todas partes. Llamados a menudo microbio-f√≥bicos. ¬†Y es que la propia obsesi√≥n por estar sanos y no enfermar puede generar tal nivel de ansiedad que muchos hipocondriacos terminan por desarrollar trastornos psicosom√°ticos. ¬†El ¬†miedo mismo es lo que desata toda esta sintomolog√≠a t√≠pica de la ansiedad aguda pudiendo causar un ritmo cardiaco acelerado, dolores de pecho, dolores musculares, ataques de p√°nico, problemas intestinales, problemas de la piel, ca√≠da del cabello, n√°useas, sudoraci√≥n, etc. ¬†que los que sufren de hipocondr√≠a malinterpretan entonces como se√±ales de una enfermedad f√≠sica. Form√°ndose as√≠ un circulo vicioso. ¬†Si ya has ido al medico, si ya las pruebas pertinentes y los profesionales de la salud te han dicho que no tienes una enfermedad, entonces hay que trabajar el aspecto psicol√≥gico y emocional. A la hora de reducir la ansiedad por hipocondria es necesario entender que su emoci√≥n principal es el miedo.¬† Mas adelante, durante la meditaci√≥n DESCUBRIREMOS CUALES SON TUS MIEDOS Y LO QUE HA ESTADO SUCEDIENDO EN TU VIDA. ¬†As√≠ que quiero animarte a que me escuches y te quedes conmigo hasta el final de la meditaci√≥n. Te cambiara la vida. Pocas cosas pueden ser tan terap√©uticas como la meditacion y su poder para reducir la ansiedad cuenta con gran respaldo cient√≠fico. Empezar√°s a ver las cosas de otro modo. Te ayudar√° a mirar los problemas desde otra perspectiva, aliviara tus ansiedades, y mejorar√° tu autoestima, liberando tu mente y tu coraz√≥n. As√≠ que Qu√©date hasta el final. porque vale la pena. Te lo aseguro! ¬† Diana¬† M√©todo Luz Propia  ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/message Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/support

La neuropsicologia definisce questa capacit√†: "ampliare la nostra finestra di tolleranza". title: Your Success is 80% Psychology | How to Use Mindfulness and Meditation to Prime Your Nervous System for Peak Performance
description: Mindfulness and meditation aren‚Äôt just about spirituality or stress relief. In today‚Äôs world of constant demands and digital distractions, mindfulness is about making your moments truly matter and living up to your full potential. It‚Äôs about your power to put your attention where you want it to be and not on what someone else dangles on a screen in front of you. This is just one reason why Tony Robbins incorporates a gratitude meditation into his daily morning routine to prime his mind every single day. If you‚Äôre familiar with any of Tony Robbins peak performance strategies, you know that your ability to maintain a peak state is a key component of living the life you desire. Your state is affected by the way you use your physical body, your ability to direct your mind‚Äôs focus, and the language or meaning you give to your experiences. Knowing this, it‚Äôs no wonder that we aren‚Äôt able to be the best version of ourselves when we are in a stressed state. The incoherence of our head and heart, the jitters in our nervous system and body makes us less effective and less resourceful. In this 1-hour episode you‚Äôll hear from Tony Robbins, his wife Sage Robbins, and podcast host Mary B. as they discuss one of the most valuable skills to maximize your mindset and prime yourself for power, clarity, concentration, and focused attention. ¬† SHOW NOTES [0:00] Hi it‚Äôs Tony Robbins‚Ä¶ [1:15] I used to think meditation was a waste of time [2:00] We don‚Äôt experience life, we experience the life we pay attention to [2:39] Tony and wife Sage and traveled the globe together for 22 years [3:30] A podcast on meditation? I‚Äôd be outta here. But‚Ä¶ [4:03] Twin hearts Sage and Tony Robbins [5:30] Why does time go so fast? [6:20] One of us is a meditator and one of us is not [7:12] Meditation definition | What is meditation, really? [8:20] Styles of meditation [9:57] What‚Äôs your outcome? [10:30] The science of meditation [11:24] Be here now and notice [12:24] Our attention is the most important commodity [13:15] Self-judgement and imposter syndrome [15:50] Ellen Langer Harvard mindfulness [16:37] Just close your eyes for a minute [17:28] I‚Äôm thinking about a grilled cheese sandwich [18:23] Meditation is not something to achieve, it‚Äôs something to experience [19:04] The throughline is gratitude [19:30] Thoughts are like clouds floating by [20:22] How do I stop the thoughts in my mind? [21:25] There‚Äôs an entire universe inside of us [22:22] Collective mind [23:19] Sage and her baby in the rain [24:25] In the busy-ness we miss the nuances [25:00] Mary B: Meditation has gotten really trendy [26:25] Story: Full Moon Meditation with Tony, Sage, Billy Beck and Mary B. [29:13] We will never experience this moment of life again [29:43] Profound knowledge *Show notes continue on website page Original Music by Abhinav and Sage Robbins

title: 25¬∞ Puntata "Assaporare il positivo"
description: In questa puntata faremo la pratica di "Assaporare il positivo". La ricerca ha provato che la razza umana si √® evoluta tenendo conto delle esperienze negative, le informazioni ci sono state trasmesse attraverso il Dna. Per milioni di anni, portare attenzione ai pericoli, ovvero reagire intensamente e mantenerne il ricordo, √® stata una questione di vita o di morte.Quindi reagiamo sempre pi√π prontamente alle esperienze negative per evitare il pericolo.Secondo il dottor Rick Hanson autore del libro ‚Äúil cervello del Budda‚Äù siamo come ‚ÄúVelcro per il negativo e Teflon per il positivo‚Äù.Ma perch√® questa ‚Äúpropensione alla negativit√†‚Äù pu√≤ nuocere al nostro benessere?Secondo il dottor Hanson, gli stimoli negativi impegnano molto il cervello e sono rilevati pi√π facilmente e velocemente. L‚Äôamigdala (regione del cervello che regola le emozioni, usa 2/3 dei suoi neuroni soltanto per rilevare quello che percepiamo come pericolo.In questo caso vuol dire che, spesso prendiamo decisioni importanti non per ottenere miglioramenti, ma esclusivamente per evitare brutte esperienze. Si spiega cos√¨ come mai √® cos√¨ difficile uscire dalla ‚ÄúZona Comfort‚ÄùRiconoscere le esperienze quotidiane positive permette la crescita di nuovi e positivi collegamenti sinapsici nel cervello.Le esperienze positive non devono necessariamente essere grandiose, ma bastano quelle semplici piacevoli sensazioni che si possono avere bevendo un buon caff√®, oppure trascorrendo un po' di tempo con una persona simpatica o la soddisfazione per aver completato un lavoro.

title: Mindfulness made easy - reduce your stress anytime, anywhere with these five simple meditations
description: Its not always easy to find the time to meditate, so getting your ten minutes a day can be really challenging. However, you can integrate mindfulness into your daily life by learning simple techniques that you can use anytime, anywhere: focusing on your breath, a counting meditation, meditation of mind, meditation of body and listening meditation. Learning and practising these these easy techniques will reduce your stress in the short term and could make a significant difference to your mental health in the long term. Meditation ¬†can be used to reduce stress / anxiety, improve your mood and live a ¬†more peaceful, fulfilled life. If you find it helpful, I invite you to ¬†share with others and say hello!¬†¬† If you're on Apple podcasts, you may wish to leave a review. May you be happy, may you be peaceful, may you be healthy and live a long life. title: Dos minutos para conectar con el momento presente y cambiar tu vida. Comienza tu viaje hacia una existencia m√°s consciente y significativa
description: ¬°Hola! Soy Mar Herrero, instructora de mindfulness y te doy la bienvenida a "Instantes de calma: Minutos Mindfulness". ¬øSientes que te falta tiempo? ¬°No te preocupes! Recuerda, la magia est√° en la atenci√≥n plena, y solo te tomar√° unos pocos minutos al d√≠a. ¬°Es hora de regalarte este presente!  Beneficios Inimaginables en Minutos mindfulness. La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness puede cambiar tu vida de maneras que nunca imaginaste. Al invertir tan solo unos minutos al d√≠a, cosechar√°s innumerables beneficios:   Paz Interior desde un minuto: ¬øSientes que la vida te arrastra? Las pr√°cticas de mindfulness a partir de un minuto te ayudar√°n a encontrar calma en medio del caos.  Claridad Mental: Practicar mindfulness regularmente te ayuda a calmar la mente, lo que puede mejorar tu capacidad de concentraci√≥n y toma de decisiones. Experimenta una mente m√°s n√≠tida y enfocada. Toma decisiones con confianza y enfrenta desaf√≠os con tranquilidad.  Reducci√≥n del Estr√©s: Libera tensiones y estr√©s acumulado en solo unos minutos. Descubre c√≥mo aliviar la ansiedad y el agobio cotidiano. Tomar solo unos minutos al comienzo o al final del d√≠a para meditar puede ayudarte a liberar tensiones acumuladas y afrontar el estr√©s de manera m√°s efectiva.  Mejora en las Relaciones: La practica regular de la atenci√≥n plena puede mejorar tus relaciones personales al ayudarte a estar presente y comunicarte de manera m√°s efectiva. Al cultivar la conciencia plena, puedes aprender a comunicarte de manera m√°s efectiva, lo que puede fortalecer tus relaciones personales y profesionales.  Autoconocimiento: Conectar√°s contigo mismo de una manera m√°s profunda. Aprende a conocerte, aceptarte y amarte tal como eres. Las pr√°cticas de mindfulness te ayudan a tomar conciencia de tus h√°bitos y comportamientos, lo que facilita la adopci√≥n de h√°bitos m√°s saludables y la superaci√≥n de comportamientos no deseados.  Bienestar F√≠sico: La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness puede reducir la presi√≥n arterial, mejorar la calidad del sue√±o y aumentar la inmunidad.  Bienestar Emocional: La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness te permite estar en sinton√≠a con tus emociones, lo que puede ayudarte a gestionarlas de manera m√°s saludable y experimentar una mayor paz interior.    Mejor Sue√±o: Practicar antes de dormir puede mejorar la calidad de tu sue√±o al calmar la mente y relajar el cuerpo.  Mayor Resiliencia: A medida que desarrollas la capacidad de aceptar y afrontar los desaf√≠os con calma, te vuelves m√°s resiliente ante las adversidades de la vida.  Mayor Consciencia del Presente: Te ayuda a vivir plenamente el momento presente, disfrutando de las peque√±as alegr√≠as de la vida que a menudo pasamos por alto.  Integrar estas pr√°cticas en tu rutina diaria no solo te proporcionar√° momentos de calma y tranquilidad, sino que tambi√©n puede transformar la forma en que experimentas el mundo y te relacionas con √©l. ¬°Empieza tu viaje hacia una vida m√°s consciente y equilibrada hoy mismo! Gracias y disfruta del d√≠a! Mar Herrero. Instructora Mindfulness. title: Tres minutos de meditaci√≥n para una existencia m√°s consciente y significativa
description: ¬°Hola! Soy Mar Herrero, instructora de mindfulness y te doy la bienvenida a "Instantes de calma: Minutos Mindfulness". ¬øSientes que te falta tiempo? ¬°No te preocupes! Esta serie te ofrece la flexibilidad de practicar a tu propio ritmo. Desde un minuto hasta el tiempo que dispongas, elige la duraci√≥n que se ajuste a tu d√≠a. Incluso un solo minuto de atenci√≥n plena puede marcar la diferencia. Te invito a regalarte el poder del presente. No importa cu√°n ajetreada sea tu vida, siempre hay un espacio para la consciencia plena. Esta serie te empoderar√° para abrazar el momento presente y vivir una vida m√°s plena. ¬øListo para liberar el estr√©s de tu vida? √önete a cientos de personas que ya est√°n disfrutando de los beneficios del mindfulness en "Instantes conscientes: Minutos Mindfulness" y comienza tu viaje hacia una existencia m√°s consciente y significativa. Recuerda, la magia est√° en la atenci√≥n plena, y solo te tomar√° unos pocos minutos al d√≠a. ¬°Es hora de regalarte este presente!  Beneficios Inimaginables en Minutos mindfulness. La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness puede cambiar tu vida de maneras que nunca imaginaste. Al invertir tan solo unos minutos al d√≠a, cosechar√°s innumerables beneficios:   Paz Interior desde un minuto: ¬øSientes que la vida te arrastra? Las pr√°cticas de mindfulness a partir de un minuto te ayudar√°n a encontrar calma en medio del caos.  Claridad Mental: Practicar mindfulness regularmente te ayuda a calmar la mente, lo que puede mejorar tu capacidad de concentraci√≥n y toma de decisiones. Experimenta una mente m√°s n√≠tida y enfocada. Toma decisiones con confianza y enfrenta desaf√≠os con tranquilidad.  Reducci√≥n del Estr√©s: Libera tensiones y estr√©s acumulado en solo unos minutos. Descubre c√≥mo aliviar la ansiedad y el agobio cotidiano. Tomar solo unos minutos al comienzo o al final del d√≠a para meditar puede ayudarte a liberar tensiones acumuladas y afrontar el estr√©s de manera m√°s efectiva.  Mejora en las Relaciones: La practica regular de la atenci√≥n plena puede mejorar tus relaciones personales al ayudarte a estar presente y comunicarte de manera m√°s efectiva. Al cultivar la conciencia plena, puedes aprender a comunicarte de manera m√°s efectiva, lo que puede fortalecer tus relaciones personales y profesionales.  Autoconocimiento: Conectar√°s contigo mismo de una manera m√°s profunda. Aprende a conocerte, aceptarte y amarte tal como eres. Las pr√°cticas de mindfulness te ayudan a tomar conciencia de tus h√°bitos y comportamientos, lo que facilita la adopci√≥n de h√°bitos m√°s saludables y la superaci√≥n de comportamientos no deseados.  Bienestar F√≠sico: La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness puede reducir la presi√≥n arterial, mejorar la calidad del sue√±o y aumentar la inmunidad.  Bienestar Emocional: La pr√°ctica regular de mindfulness te permite estar en sinton√≠a con tus emociones, lo que puede ayudarte a gestionarlas de manera m√°s saludable y experimentar una mayor paz interior.    Mejor Sue√±o: Practicar antes de dormir puede mejorar la calidad de tu sue√±o al calmar la mente y relajar el cuerpo.  Mayor Resiliencia: A medida que desarrollas la capacidad de aceptar y afrontar los desaf√≠os con calma, te vuelves m√°s resiliente ante las adversidades de la vida.  Mayor Consciencia del Presente: Te ayuda a vivir plenamente el momento presente, disfrutando de las peque√±as alegr√≠as de la vida que a menudo pasamos por alto.  Integrar estas pr√°cticas en tu rutina diaria no solo te proporcionar√° momentos de calma y tranquilidad, sino que tambi√©n puede transformar la forma en que experimentas el mundo y te relacionas con √©l. ¬°Empieza tu viaje hacia una vida m√°s consciente y equilibrada hoy mismo! title: Mindfulness of the Head Space, A Meditation with Sean Fargo
description: We‚Äôre often ‚Äúcaught up in our heads,‚Äù pushed and pulled by our thoughts. In mindfulness practice, we typically balance this thought-centered focus by directing awareness away from the head to the body and heart. In this guided meditation, Sean Fargo invites us to take a different approach. We practice intentionally remaining in the headspace, observing sensation (versus thoughts) in and around the head with tenderness, care and a gentle awareness.¬†¬† Please listen in a safe, quiet place where you can be relatively free from distraction. Find a posture that balances comfort with alertness, whether standing, seated, or lying down. May this meditation be of benefit to you in your mindfulness journey. Sean Fargo is a former Buddhist monk and founder of the online resource, Mindfulness Exercises. Mindfulness Exercises has shared mindfulness with over 6 million people via free and premium services including downloadable meditations, meditation scripts, mindfulness worksheets, courses, content and live online retreats. Enhance your personal practice or guide others in meditation with 200 Guided Meditation Scripts. These scripts are for mindfulness and meditation teachers, therapists, counselors, coaches, healers, yoga instructors and anyone who wants to share mindfulness with others.  Teach meditation with more confidence and skill  Grow your mindfulness business or practice  Reach more clients with shareable content  Add more variety to your current meditation sessions  Each of our 200 guided meditation scripts comes as a beautifully designed, separate PDF file. You can read them word-for-word, make them your own, record them or use them to create videos for individuals or groups. Learn more at https://mindfulnessexercises.com/guided-meditation-scripts/

Por eso, cuando esta conexi√≥n se afecta negativamente por el estr√©s, pueden ocurrir s√≠ntomas indeseables, como malestares estomacales, diarrea y estre√±imiento cr√≥nicos. ¬†A su vez, quien sufre de estas molestias intestinales tiende a sentir aun m√°s ansiedad, gener√°ndose as√≠ un circulo vicioso de ansiedad y estr√©s. No es por nada que muchos cient√≠ficos se refieren al intestino como el "segundo cerebro" o "cerebro intestinal", ya que el tubo digestivo contiene una compleja red neuronal muy parecida a la actividad neuronal del cerebro. ¬†Ya sea tu cerebro o tus intestinos los responsables de tu estr√©s, el estre√±imiento no es algo divertido. Ahora rel√°jate y vamos a meditar, usando mindfulness y relajando primeramente el cuerpo a travez de la respiraci√≥n y luego relajando la mente, abriendo paso al poder sanativo de tu propio cuerpo. Esta meditaci√≥n te ayudar√° a relajarte y a recalibrar tu sistema nervioso, lo que a su vez te ayudara a remover bloqueos energ√©ticos causados por el estr√©s. ¬†Lo m√°s importante es que mantengas tu propio ritmo de respiraci√≥n. Yo te ofrecer√© pautas y recordatorios pero no te preocupes por seguir todo al pie de la letra. Respira naturalmente cuando tengas que respirar. ¬†¬†Valga recalcar que la meditaci√≥n no es sustituto del cuidado medico. El prop√≥sito de esta meditacion es √∫nicamente aliviar la ansiedad y el estr√©s ayud√°ndote a encontrar paz en medio de un ambiente y un mundo ca√≥tico. Recordemos que una mente y un cuerpo estresados son mas susceptibles a las enfermedades. Seg√∫n varios estudios, la meditaci√≥n ayuda a mejorar la digestion. ¬†Si te gusta esta meditaci√≥n, suscr√≠bete a mi canal y ay√∫dame compartiendo el video con tus amigos. #RemediosNaturales #MeditacionGuiada #Estre√±imiento  ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/message Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/support

title: #5 English Learning Mindfulness
description: Show notes page - https://levelupenglish.school/podcast5Become a Level Up Member¬†- https://levelupenglish.schoolTranscript¬†- https://levelupenglish.school/transcripts (Members Only)Text:When I was first learning to meditate, the instruction was to simply pay attention to my breath, and when my mind wandered, to bring it back.Why is it so hard to pay attention? Well, studies show that even when we‚Äôre really trying to pay attention to something ‚Äî like maybe this talk ‚Äî at some point, about half of us will drift off into a daydream, or have this urge to check our Twitter feed.Instead of this hunger signal coming from our stomach, this emotional signal ‚Äî feeling sad ‚Äî triggers that urge to eat.What if instead of fighting our brains, or trying to force ourselves to pay attention, we instead tapped into this natural, reward-based learning process?And this is what mindfulness is all about: Seeing really clearly what we get when we get caught up in our behaviours.We start to notice that cravings are simply made up of body sensations ‚Äî oh, there‚Äôs tightness, there‚Äôs tension, there‚Äôs restlessness.Word MeaningsMind-wandering - to think about past memories or future worriesDrift off - To float away gently (a boat, your mind...)Urge - The strong feeling of desire to do something without thoughtTrigger - Something that causes something else to happenTo tap into - To find the hidden ability inside yourself or something elseTo get caught up in - To get distracting by doing somethingTo crave - When your body wants somethingRestlessness - The feeling of being impatient and unable to stay stillTED Talk: https://www.ted.com/talks/judson_brewer_a_simple_way_to_break_a_bad_habit?language=en------------------Website: www.ewmichael.comEmail: info@ewmichael.comInstagram: @english_with_michaelFacebook: /englishwithmichaelYoutube: /c/englishwithmichaelSupport the show

title: What is mindfulness?
description: If you're new to mindfulness or already practice, refreshing the fundamentals every so often is worthwhile. Mindfulness is about the here and now - focusing 100% of your attention on whatever you‚Äôre doing, being present with whatever you‚Äôre experiencing. Trying to be calm or happy doesn‚Äôt work - chasing after things which will make us happy doesn‚Äôt tend to either. Practicing mindfulness doesn‚Äôt switch off difficult emotions but through regular practice it can help us to transform difficult feelings and limit the damage that anxiety, anger and sadness can do to ourselves and others. We have a Facebook group - if you find the podcast helpful, join and share: ¬†https://www.facebook.com/groups/999461463825856/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/mindfulness_for Meditation ¬†can be used to reduce stress / anxiety, improve your mood and live a ¬†more peaceful, fulfilled life. If you find it helpful, I invite you to share on Facebook and say hello! If you're on itunes / Apple Podcasts, you may wish to leave a review. May you be happy, may you be peaceful, may you be healthy and live a long life.

title: 34¬∞ Puntata "Rilassamento consapevole"
description: Quando veniamo innescati da qualcosa che percepiamo come minaccia, entriamo automaticamente nel meccanismo di fuga o attacco. Ora, se i fattori scatenanti sono continui, come lo stress quotidiano, il nostro sistema nervoso si sovraccarica e si blocca in uno stato continuo di attacco o fuga.Ci√≤ significa che i nostri corpi sono continuamente alterati nella biochimica dello stress, con un  aumento di adrenalina e cortisolo e i nostri muscoli sono cronicamente tesi. Quindi, quando capiamo di essere stressati, possiamo imparare a fare una pausa, rilassare il nostro corpo e iniziare a tornare a casa alla nostra presenza naturale. Il primo passo per rilassarci √® notare la nostra tensione, la nostra abituale armatura. Il rilassamento avviene naturalmente quando portiamo una delicata consapevolezza alle aree di tensione del nostro corpo.

title: üéßMeditaci√≥n Para Ponerte Feliz! Sube y Mejora tu Autoestima
description: Autoestima for los suelos? Esta meditaci√≥n te ayudara inmediatamente a subir tu autoestima y a mejorar tu auto imagen. ¬†Cuando te preguntes: ¬†Porque siento que soy feo y nadie me quiere? Porque me siento FEA y POCO ATRACTIVA? Qu√© hacer cuando me siento insuficiente? Qu√© hacer cuando me siento in√∫til? Qu√© hacer cuando me siento triste y deprimida? Qu√© hacer cuando me siento solo y vac√≠o? ¬†Has esta meditaci√≥n guiada y veras como en seguida te sube el animo y te sientes mejor! ¬†Siempre habr√°n infinitas razones que nos llevan a auto-detestarnos, pero lo que verdaderamente decide como te juzgas a ti mismo, no son tus ojos, ni los ojos de otros, si no la condici√≥n de tu alma. A veces las opiniones de otros lastiman tu alma, como en el caso del bullying, ya sea en el colegio, en el trabajo, o en tu propia casa. A veces tus propias opiniones sobre ti lastiman tu alma. La causa de la baja autoestima es casi siempre interna ya sea porque nos auto-juzgamos demasiado, o porque nos tenemos el habito de compararnos todo el tiempo con otras personas, o porque hemos aceptado como verdades las opiniones de otros. Nos sentimos feos porque algo esta yendo mal a nivel psicol√≥gico, mas no a nivel f√≠sico. Pero esto se puede cambiar! ¬†Si no logramos sobreponernos a los pensamientos negativos de nuestra mente, puede llegar un momento en que dejamos de confiar en nosotros mismos y es ahi cuando cuando nuestra auto imagen se deteriora. Cuando nuestro mundo se viene abajo. ¬†La auto imagen es esa fotograf√≠a interna que todos tenemos de nosotros mismos. Cuando piensas en ti mismo, es la opinion que tienes de tus habilidades, apariencia y personalidad. Todos tenemos una auto imagen de nosotros mismos. La auto imagen representa las emociones que sientes cuando piensas en ti, y est√° presente, cada vez que te dices ‚Äúyo soy‚Äù o ‚Äúyo no soy‚Äù y es la responsable de decir ‚Äúyo puedo‚Äù o ‚Äúyo no puedo‚Äù. ¬†Tu auto imagen y tu auto estima te traen desdicha cada vez que aceptas las historias negativas que genera tu mente. Las emociones y las imagines que percibes cuando piensas en ti mismo son important√≠simas para el buen vivir. Por eso, no permitas que una autoimagen distorsionada y equivocada impidan tu felicidad. Es necesario ser generoso y compasivo contigo mismo creando y repitiendo una historia diferente. Aprende con migo como cambiar la historia que se repite en tu mente. Esta meditaci√≥n sirve para mejorar tu auto imagen de adentro hacia afuera. ¬†Meditaci√≥n Guiada para Mejorar tu Autoestima y tu Auto Imagen  ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/message Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/metodo-luz-propia/support

title: Mindfulness, Concentration and Insight ‚Äì Where to Start? (Episode #3)
description: Welcome to episode three of The Way Out Is In: The Zen Art of Living, a podcast series mirroring Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh‚Äôs deep teachings of Buddhist philosophy: a simple yet profound methodology for dealing with our suffering, and for creating more happiness and joy in our lives.    In this episode, Zen Buddhist monk Brother Phap Huu and lay Buddhist practitioner and journalist Jo Confino talk about the ancient roots of mindfulness and its growing contemporary popularity.¬†    Along with special guest Sister Trai Nghiem, from the Plum Village community, the hosts further discuss the differences between mindfulness and concentration; how to deal with strong emotions; ways to awaken the seeds of awareness and mindfulness; being present to ourselves; asking for forgiveness.¬†    All three share insights about changes mindfulness has brought to their personal lives: ‚Äúthe fruit of the practice‚Äù.¬†    Brother Phap Huu explains what it means to dwell in the present moment; shares observations about Thich Nhat Hanh‚Äôs daily mindfulness practice and his ‚Äúsuperpower‚Äù; addresses the different styles of walking meditation and how to make the most of nature‚Äôs energy; and considers the importance of resting in today‚Äôs society.    Both monastics go on to share about the weekly ‚Äòlazy day‚Äô in a busy monastery, and why this may just be the most advanced practice day.¬†¬†¬†    Jo contributes memories of Thich Nhat Hanh explaining the difference between practicing concentration and practicing mindfulness; ways to heal past wounds by being in the present moment; and methods for getting instant understanding when we are good observers of ourselves.    Sister Trai Nghiem shares about her spiritual journey to becoming a nun, and about life in the nunnery before and during the pandemic; being a musician both inside and outside of the monastery; combining playing violin with mindfulness; and how she let go of professional goals for perfection, instead just enjoying the energy of music created by the monastic community.¬†¬†    Finally, the sister ends the episode with a guided meditation.    Co-produced by the Plum Village App:https://plumvillage.app/    And Global Optimism:https://globaloptimism.com/    With support from the Thich Nhat Hanh Foundation:https://thichnhathanhfoundation.org/        List of resourcesPlum Village Communityhttps://plumvillage.org/    Buddha‚Äôs Noble Eightfold Pathhttps://plumvillage.org/library/dharma-talks/the-noble-eightfold-path/¬†    Books by Thich Nhat Hanhhttps://plumvillage.org/about/thich-nhat-hanh/key-books/    John Bradshawhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Bradshaw_(author)Namo Avalokiteshvaraya https://plumvillage.org/library/chants/namo-avalokiteshvaraya/¬†    Samsarahttps://plumvillage.org/library/dharma-talks/nirvana-is-in-samsara-samsara-is-in-nirvana-dharma-talk-by-sr-chan-duc-2018-06-21/¬†    Sanghahttps://plumvillage.org/about/international-sangha-directory/¬†    Lazy dayshttps://web.plumvillage.app/item/give-yourself-a-lazy-day        Quotes    ‚ÄúMindfulness is the capacity to also see the beauty of life.‚Äù    ‚ÄúWhen we observe ourselves as though we‚Äôre an outsider looking in, then we can develop instant understandings.‚Äù    ‚ÄúTo develop the seed of mindfulness, we need a few formal practices that we can develop in our daily life; that way, we can always come back to them when strong emotions come up. We want to invite mindfulness to be present to take care of these strong emotions.‚Äù    ‚ÄúMindfulness is the energy of cultivating awareness in our daily life.‚Äù¬†    ‚ÄúOnly when we‚Äôre truly ourselves can we go into the past and heal things, because we‚Äôre bringing that awareness of who we truly are. It‚Äôs about lifting the veil and being present to ourselves.‚Äù‚ÄúIf you want to take care of the future, learn to handle the present moment.‚Äù    ‚ÄúZen Master Thich Nhat Hanh would define love as understanding, because if you want to have compassion and love, you have to have understanding. And to have understanding, you need attention and time and focus.‚Äù    ‚ÄúWe like to invite people to connect to their breath, letting that breath become a bridge. As they become aware of the breath, suddenly they bring their attention and mind to their body.‚Äù    ‚ÄúThere are so many people trying to change the world who are burning out, who don‚Äôt really realize that you can only change the world if you change yourself.‚Äù    ‚ÄúPracticing mindfulness is not just practicing when we suffer. This is really important. Our teacher would encourage us to invest in our practice right now, when we‚Äôre happy, because when the storm arises, you don‚Äôt go look for a refuge. At that moment, you are the refuge.‚Äù¬†    ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no such thing as a thought or an action that is neutral. Everything has an impact. That means that every time we open our mouths, every time we have a thought, it‚Äôs either going to create something of beauty or it‚Äôs going to create hardship.‚Äù    ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs interesting to see how, when we feel spacious inside, physical space outside doesn‚Äôt really matter. We can be anywhere and feel spacious and happy.‚Äù¬†    ‚ÄúTo create change in our world, we have to come back to ourselves. And when we come back to ourselves ‚Äì wow, we can really change the world.‚Äù

description: Costuma-se dizer que mindfulness e a¬†compaix√£o¬†s√£o as "duas asas do p√°ssaro da sabedoria".¬†Uma das defini√ß√µes cient√≠ficas mais aceitas √© a de¬†Goetz¬†e colegas: "o sentimento que surge ao se presenciar e reconhecer o sofrimento do outro, que implica um desejo ou motiva√ß√£o de ajudar". Envolveria a "empatia" pelo sofrimento alheio, ou seja, a capacidade de sentir e entender as emo√ß√µes e o mal-estar de outra pessoa. O mesmo conceito se aplica √† "autocompaix√£o", trocando o "outro" por "mim mesmo". Essas defini√ß√µes implicam no reconhecimento do sofrimento como parte da vida de todos n√≥s, o que chamamos de "humanidade compartilhada", e seria como um ant√≠doto ao estado habitual de nossa mente, que privilegia a (auto)cr√≠tica e culpa excessivas, o que acaba gerando mais¬†sofrimento frente ao mal-estar. title: 40¬∞ Puntata "Relazionarci ai pensieri con saggezza"
description: Quando ci alleniamo alla consapevolezza, non cerchiamo di smettere di pensare. Piuttosto, la nostra intenzione √® di coltivare una relazione saggia con i pensieri. Questo diventa particolarmente importante quando abbiamo a che fare con pensieri e convinzioni negative o minacciose. C'√® un detto: "I pensieri fanno un buon servitore, ma un povero padrone". Le convinzioni che attraversano la nostra mente su noi stessi e gli altri sono spesso storie dolorosamente limitanti. Senza consapevolezza, possiamo finire per vedere le nostre vite attraverso una serie di credenze e storie che, per anni, ci impediscono di essere fiduciosi, creano conflitti o distanza dagli altri, ci tengono intrappolati nei dubbi su noi stessi o nei sentimenti di fallimento

title: The power of your smile

title: What Is Mindfulness, Really? And How Do You Know if You‚Äôre Doing It Right? | Diana Winston
description: Mindfulness is a word that is in danger of becoming meaningless. In this episode, we dig into the meaning of mindfulness, how to practice without getting overwhelmed, and how to stop the judgment spiral.Today‚Äôs guest is Diana Winston, the Director of Mindfulness Education at UCLA‚Äôs Mindful Awareness Research Center. She has written several books, including The Little Book of Being, and Fully Present, the Science, Art and Practice of Mindfulness, which she co-authored with Susan Smalley, and which is celebrating its tenth anniversary. Diana has been practicing mindfulness meditation since 1989, including a year as a Buddhist nun in Burma.¬†In this episode we talk about:How Diana defines mindfulnessHow we know if we‚Äôre in a state of bonafide mindfulnessThe difference between mindfulness as a trait and mindfulness as a state¬†Whether you have to meditate to achieve mindfulness as a traitWhat current scientific research says about the benefits of meditationThe link between intuition, happiness and authenticityHer definition of happinessHow meditation can help us relate to our bodies differentlyHow to stop the self-judgment spiralCreating a top ten list to deal with difficult thoughtsHow to use meditation for chronic painStriking a balance between reason and intuitionThe ripple effects of practicing meditationAnd how to start practicing mindfulness without getting overwhelmedFull Shownotes:https://www.tenpercent.com/tph/podcast-episode/diana-winstonSee Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

title: 5 Mindfulness Practices for Stress Relief in Any Workplace & 5 Simple Habits to Improve Your Focus

We discuss what it takes to be truly happy, the practice of mindfulness, processing the thoughts in your head to truly understand yourself, and finding your true purpose in life.¬†¬†¬†¬†You can order my new book 8 RULES OF LOVE at 8rulesoflove.com or at a retail store near you. You can also get the chance to see me live on my first ever world tour. This is a 90 minute interactive show where I will take you on a journey of finding, keeping and even letting go of love. Head to jayshettytour.com and find out if I'll be in a city near you. Thank you so much for all your support - I hope to see you soon.Key Takeaways:00:00 Intro01:17 Becoming a monk - What can you learn from monkhood?04:00 Self mastery is purifying yourself from your ego.06:26 What happened next after leaving the monk life?10:34 Sharing mindfulness practices to help relieve stress in any workspace12:44 The many benefits of meditation that people don‚Äôt realize14:25 There is more to proper breathing when it comes to meditation17:12 Here‚Äôs how you can safely and properly practice meditation20:58 Change the way you look at things and everything else will change for the better23:52 Finding purpose after getting rejected and not losing sight of your goal29:55 Learning more about life by talking with people from different backgrounds33:56 When it comes to meditation, start with the amount of time you can37:29 Finding balance in the pros and cons of social media39:29 The 5 habits to help you start improving your daily life43:29 Let‚Äôs meditateLike this show? Please leave us a review here - even one sentence helps! Post a screenshot of you listening on Instagram & tag us so we can thank you personally!Want to be a Jay Shetty Certified Life Coach? title: The Noble Eightfold Path: Right Mindfulness
description: Today, Sam continues to break down the teachings of the Eightfold Path. In this episode, she goes back to basics with a guide to mindfulness and all the benefits it can bring. Sam has taught mindfulness and social emotional learning to teens, families and adults all over the world for more than 12 years. She obtained her master‚Äôs degrees in clinical and educational psychology from Columbia University, and an M.S. in emotion science from Mid-Sweden University. title: Essential Mindfulness Practices: 5 Reasons To Learn This Today
description: As more people are becoming aware of the importance of mental health, mindfulness practices are becoming an increasingly popular topic, and for good reason. Free Weekly Newsletter To Learn Meditation So You Can Meditate More Effectively HERE... Mindfulness practices will positively impact the mind, body, and soul dramatically, allowing you to be happier and healthier. Let's look at 5 specific reasons why you should practice mindfulness today: 1. Benefits Your Mind Whether you are in school or retirement, it is important to keep your mind in tip-top shape. If not, you will not feel or perform as efficiently as you could. This could negatively impact your career, hobbies, or relationships with other people. Mindfulness has wonderful benefits for your mind. Studies have found that mindfulness practices can increase the density of gray matter in brain regions associated with learning and memory. What this means is that mindfulness makes you a better learner. 2. Increases Focus Focus is an incredibly integral aspect of our minds. It affects all aspects of life, from driving your car to getting coffee with a friend. If we cannot focus, then we will have trouble learning, improving our skills, or connecting with those around us. Luckily, mindfulness increases focus. Several studies have found that mindfulness practices help you tune out distractions. As a result, this improves your attention skills, which then allows you to learn and recall information better. 3. Benefits The Body In addition to improving your mind, mindfulness greatly benefits the body. From boosting your immune system to reducing the risk of cardiovascular disease, mindfulness is one of the best ways, besides regular exercise and eating healthily, to improve your physical health and fitness. Research has found that mindfulness boosts the immune system, making it easier for your body to fight off illness. Additionally, studies have found that mindfulness also encourages healthier eating habits, helps people lose weight, and helps them savor the food they eat. As a result, mindfulness helps to prevent obesity. 4. Regulates Emotions And Improves Mental Illness Emotions and mental illness are difficult topics to improve and regulate simply because they are more difficult to detect and diagnose. Mindfulness is a simple way to both regulate emotions and improve the effects of mental illness. Countless studies have shown that mindfulness decreases emotional reactivity and increases cognitive focus. This will allow you to better regulate your emotions since you have fewer negative ones to start with. As a result, it improves your compassion for others, making it more likely that you will help someone in need, as well as boost self-compassion.¬† 5. Fosters Compassion Compassion and altruism are two characteristics that most people strive to have. They allow us to connect with other people and help those in need. Though some people seem to be more compassionate than others, there are ways to increase your compassion, such as through mindfulness. Final Thoughts To recap, everyone wants to be the best version of themselves, and mindfulness is one of the best ways to accomplish this. It will allow you to have a healthier mind, a healthier body, and a more giving spirit. For these reasons, you should start learning mindfulness practices today. title: Over-coming childhood trauma, mindfulness, and learning how to be in a relationship with Cory Allen
description: In this episiode, Jillian speaks with Cory Allen, meditation teacher, podcaster, audio engineer and author of "Now Is The Way". Cory overcame some pretty heavy childhood trauma through educating himself on psychology and neuroscience and teaching himself to meditate. Through years of rigorous self-examination and a determination to thrive, he worked hard to unlearn patterns that were a result of the trauma he endured. We talk about his journey, which includes his relationship with his wife -which of course Jillian asked a lot of questions about! title: You don't have to clear your mind! Other voices - Katie Sheen and Joseph Hamer
description: There's lots of misconceptions about mindfulness - some people think it's about clearing your mind, thinking positively or that it takes a lot of practice to see the benefits. In this chat with my friend and yours, Katie Sheen, ¬†we put to bed some of the myths that exist about mindfulness. Katie is a fully qualified teacher who has been practicing mindfulness in her own life for over sixteen years, including through cancer treatment in 2015. Katie teaches mindfulness courses and has created her own online course and app (links below). Free Breathworks self paced course to support through the crisis¬† Appreciating Windowsills app Katie's free Udemy Mindfulness for Anxiety course, now being watched by students in over 75 different countries! The Happiness Calendar can be accessed for free via Katie's home page I'm also joined by Joseph Hamer, author of Brain Awakes - his book is an activity guide for parents which teaches emotional regulation to children. In this episode, Joseph talks about dealing with anxiety and takes us through a 15 minute meditation. We end with a reading from Thich Nhat Hanh's book Happiness and a song - 'Easy' by the Commodores. That's why I'm easy.... I'm easy like Sunday morning... mindfulnessforbeginners@protonmail.com We have a Facebook group - join and share this episode! https://www.facebook.com/groups/999461463825856/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/mindfulness_for

description: Mindfulness √® una parola inglese che significa: Prestare attenzione, intenzionalmente  al momento presente,  in modo gentile e non giudicante ed √® anche un modo per coltivare una presenza pi√π piena all‚Äôesperienza del momento, al qui e ora.Una caratteristica di fondo dell‚Äôapproccio della mindfulness √® lo strettissimo legame con il pensiero scientifico e la ricerca. Approccio che si √® sviluppato sia sul campo, nella sperimentazione pratica, sia a partire da scientifiche ricerche rigorose che ne hanno  verificato l‚Äôeffettiva efficacia e i meccanismi di funzionamento.Abbiamo 100 mil di neuroni e Non possiamo fare a meno di pensare, ma con il training di m impariamo ad essere consapevoli quando la mente inizia a lasciarsi coinvolgere dai pensieri e a spostare intenzionalmente e con gentilezza l‚Äôattenzione al respiro ai suoni o alle sensazioni fisiche

description: Nuestra mente divaga y esto es algo natural.¬† Y comprendiendo esta idea de que divagar y desconcentrarse es una realidad, tambi√©n hay que poner a nuestra mente en un ambiente que hoy en d√≠a vive lleno de distracciones.¬† Y movernos a trav√©s de estas distracciones no es tarea f√°cil. title: Jon Kabat-Zinn - The Heart of Mindfulness
description: We're back with Season 3 of the show, starting with renowned meditation teacher, author, and creator of Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR), Jon Kabat-Zinn. This spacious and personal conversation is full of insights on a wide range of topics, including: what drew him to meditation; his development of and vision for Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR); the mystery of the line between the inside and outside of any system; adapting Buddhist practices for Western audiences; how mindfulness has been taken up in society, and science as a main driver; moving from "me" to "we"; the challenges of repeatability in scientific studies of meditation; weaving together art and science; and how 50+ years of meditation has changed him.  Full show notes and resources ¬†

title: How to Master Mindfulness with Shauna Shapiro
description: In this episode, Shauna Shapiro, a renowned expert in mindfulness and clinical psychology, shares some of the science behind mindfulness and the power of intentions. Her inspiring journey of healing and self-discovery, coupled with her studies in neuroscience and psychology, reinforced the idea that whatever we practice grows stronger and fueled her passion to help others cultivate self-compassion and gratitude. Shauna shares that by choosing kindness, gratitude, and joy, we can carve new neural pathways and experience a profound shift in our well-being. In this episode, you will be able to:  Explore the transformative power of mindfulness to unlock a greater sense of peace and clarity in your life Cultivate self-compassion and gratitude to boost your well-being and foster a positive outlook on life Learn the importance of setting intentions and how it can guide you towards living a more purposeful and fulfilling life Discover effective strategies for building habits that support mindfulness, allowing you to cultivate a regular practice in your daily life Understand the deep connection between empathy and compassion, and how nurturing both can lead to a more compassionate mindset and stronger relationships with others  To learn more, click here!See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

title: Linda Carlson ‚Äì Mindfulness and Cancer
description: In this episode, Wendy speaks with psychosocial oncology researcher Linda Carlson. Linda has pioneered the application of mindfulness and contemplative practice for cancer patients, focusing on both psychological and biological outcomes. This conversation covers many topics, including:  her path to integrating psychology, mindfulness, and cancer;   early clinical trials and positive outcomes;   how and why meditation can help with the stress of cancer;   problems with battle metaphors related to cancer;   opportunities to re-evaluate self and identity;   connecting with boundlessness and interdependence;   living well vs. living long;   study design and control groups in meditation research;   effects of mindfulness on cellular aging (telomeres);   media coverage of meditation research;   the power of preference in interventions;   sneak preview of gene expression results;   impacts on inflammation;   increasing accessibility and diversity;   working towards structural change in health care;   and building an academic society for contemplative research.  Full show notes and resources
